author: Terry Lobo
comment: Does everything I need for a watch calculator.

author: Vidi F. Studios
comment: Seeeep

author: Dakoda Koziol
comment: Great app! I do have some suggestions, however. Could you add a dedicated fractions button? Like the one they have in those TI-30Xa calculators? Its so useful, and very difficult for me to stick with a calculator that doesn't have this option (which, for whatever reason, is most). Add that and you'll definitely get that fifth star.  Also, it can be a little tedious swiping that extras-pane-thing very often. Could you try what GBoard does (if enabled)? Show the special characters behind the regular qwerty characters, sort of like a superscript. Than make it so that tapping and holding a character will be tapping a special character.  For example: long-tapping the 'd' gives me a '$' in GBoard, and I would like it so that long-tapping the '=' gives me 'X' in this Calculator. I don't think that this should replace the pane, but I would love to enable this in settings or something. Thanks for the great calculator, I hope you keep working on it! (Or Google buys it, lol)

author: Ufie Victor
comment: Best app ever.. No need of pressing the equal button. Automatic answer. You guys are doing great. I would like to get more app from you.

author: Rufat Agayev
comment: Excellent calculator. Just needs a clear all history button, would be great if you could add. Well done!
title: Needs one addition

author: Joseph Jolley
comment: This is the best calculator ever. It doesn't have any ads, and has more features than the built-in calculator.

author: Peter Nguyen
comment: This one has a pretty decent, minimalistic, and transparent calculator widget. It also has a floating calculator (haven't tested this part yet).

author: Thomas Schmall
comment: Are these buttons for mobility-challenged giants? Well, I guess it does calculations fine, but no settings and all basic.

author: Kasey Smith
comment: Not quite as intuitive as the Holo version. To get graphing you need to enter an equation, for instance 3x^-2+2, and the graph will magically appear. Unfortunately, Matrices have been removed.

author: SamBeg StHa1
comment: An Awesome calculator indeed, But the functionality has dropped since v.4 where you could solve matrix, graph and whatnot! Would love to have it all back!

author: Somjit Bhowmick
comment: Being an engineer, this has always been a great help to me for any kind of scientific calculations. Its clean, robust, and delightfully crisp. Includes an in-app 2D graph plotter for basic function visualisation.
title: Extremely useful

author: T-Bee
comment: After trying more related apps.... This one is best! Thanks man... Great work (y)

author: Rishabh Singhal
comment: Well I think that this app is way better than the default calculator on android. I suggest you to add some more features like GPA calculator, Currency converter, etc., to make it the best calculation app on Play store.

comment: 6÷2(2+1) = 9 meanwhile in the real math it's 1 because the implicit order of operations is 6÷(2(2+1)). Please fix it.
